intro: Pritzelago austroalpina, commonly known as the Austroalpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in mountainous areas. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Pritzelago austroalpina is a perennial herb that plays a role in alpine ecosystems and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
